definitions.definition: a person in your family who lived a long time ago

examples.text: His ancestors had come to America from Ireland.
He can trace his ancestors back to the reign of Elizabeth I.
He claims as his literary ancestors such giants as Henry James and William Faulkner.
Our earliest ancestors lived in a world fraught with danger.
The Romans built these monuments to glorify their illustrious ancestors.
The builder of the house was a direct ancestor of the present owner.
The two species share a common ancestor.
They honour/​honor their ancestors and believe in the spirits of nature.

definitions.definition: an animal that lived in the past that a modern animal has developed from

examples.text: a reptile that was the common ancestor of lizards and turtles

definitions.definition: an early form of a machine that later became more developed

examples.text: The ancestor of the modern bicycle was called a penny-farthing.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French ancestre, from Latin antecessor, from antecedere, from ante ‘before’ + cedere ‘go’.
